headline: Citigroup (C) Falls More Steeply Than Broader Market: What Investors Need to Know
summary: Citigroup (C) reached $87.6 at the closing of the latest trading day, reflecting a -1.26% change compared to its last close.

headline: The World’s Wealthy Want Truly Global Investments. Big Banks Are Responding.
summary: JPMorgan Chase  announced last week that it is restructuring its private bank to better serve clients who want to spread their investments across the globe.  The revamp, which was first reported by The Wall Street Journal, recognizes a demographic reality: the world’s wealthy increasingly own businesses which straddle continents, own houses in different countries, hold citizenship in different nations, and have investments across the globe.  “We are marking a significant moment for our Private Bank’s international expansion,” says Adam Tejpaul, who leads JPMorgan’s international private bank, in a statement.

headline: Wells Fargo Draws a Rare Downgrade as Wall Street Looks for Next Catalyst
summary: Gains in the stock already reflect the removal of a cap on the bank’s asset base, analysts at Raymond James say.

headline: A Relaxing Week Ahead in the Stock Market?
summary: Pre-market futures are taking a little off the top this morning: -18 points on the S&P 500, -31 points on the Dow and -98 points on the Nasdaq.

headline: Where Will Citigroup Be in 3 Years?
summary: Citigroup has been working on a company-wide transformation since 2021.  The large U.S. money center bank Citigroup (NYSE: C) has enjoyed quite the run.  Citigroup also trades at about 97% of its tangible book value (TBV), a significant discount to peers, despite having materially grown TBV per share in recent years.
